6632936:
bronchoscopy note - [REDACTED]

pt [REDACTED] mrn [REDACTED] is a 65yo male here for bronch w EBUS staging and robotic biopsy of a 15.4mm RML nodule that was ground-glass on CT, bronchus sign was positive, PET showed SUV 4.3.

under general we did linear EBUS first using the Fujifilm EB-580S scope with 21g needle and sampled stations 10R x3, 4L x2, 4R x2, 11L x4, ROSE was there and showed Adequate lymphocytes at multiple stations.

then switched to Monarch robot and navigated to the RML lateral (B4) lesion, registration was 2.5mm which is fine, got radial EBUS showing adjacent view and did tool in lesion confirmation with radial ebus. took 7 forceps bx, 4 needle passes, brushings x2, BAL sent for cultures.

ROSE from the nodule was Atypical cells.

no bleeding no ptx   patient did well

specimens to path for cyto, surgical path, cell block, flow, molecular if needed

d/c home after recovery with standard precautions, f/u 1-2wks for path

Brian O'Connor md
ip attending
